title: Renters in retirement villages should have unambiguous access to RTB, say charities for older people
content: “We don’t appear to have any regulations to cover people in that situation,” says Camille Loftus, head of advocacy for Age Action.

title: In Rathmines, plans progress for primary-care centre and housing
content: The HSE has filed a planning application for a new health-care centre at the Gulistan bring centre site.

title: Look at converting some social homes in city-centre flats into cost-rentals, says Taoiseach’s group
content: No decision has been made on whether that will happen, a Dublin City Council spokesperson has said. But it hasn’t been ruled out.

title: RTB tribunal finds Tramco renters are licencees not tenants, overturning a previous decision
content: The landlord argued that the renters in the Rathmines building were hotel guests and that they didn’t have exclusive occupation.

title: Young renter ‘forced to throw out clothes and is suffering recurring chest infections’ due to mould issues
content: A young woman renting an apartment has claimed severe issues with mould have affected her health, destroyed some of her clothing and are causing a “constant damp smell”.

title: Parents of teen killed after being left on roadside by emergency services: ‘They failed Shannon’
content: Inquiry into 2018 incident in Derry found PSNI officers breached duty of care to the law student and her boyfriend

title: Met Éireann spends almost €500,000 on planning consultants in 18 months
content: Department of Housing has paid out more than €1.4m on private planning consultants since 2020

title: From €145k to €285k: Restored Cobh home from Cheap Irish Homes for sale
content: Engineer Andrew Ryan’s €25,000 renovation transformed a 200-year-old Cobh terrace into a vibrant, turnkey starter home

title: ‘He’s been in ads for Yves Saint Laurent’: Behind the scenes at a championship dog show
content: From impeccable grooming to razor sharp handling, Gemma Tipton goes behind the scenes to see just what it takes to win at a championship dog show

title: Planning retention refused for Airbnb operator in Dublin
content: Dublin City Council has refused planning retention to a significant Airbnb operator close to Dublin Castle and Temple Bar to continue offering its apartments for short-term letting to tourists.

title: Dublin City Council refuses permission for operator to rent 10 apartments near Temple Bar
content: Dublin Castle Suites advertises its 10 apartments on the AirBnB platform and can earn up to €350 per night per apartment on busy weekends.

title: DAFT.IE PROPERTY MAGAZINE
content: An indoor pool and uninterrupted sea views beside the beach for €1,250,000
